intro: Onychium tetraedre, commonly known as the four-edged onychium, is a member of the Primulaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinct four-lobed structure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Onychium tetraedre is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
